directions: In a large, heavy pot, heat the oil over moderate heat, then add the onions, celery, bell pepper, and garlic, and cook, stirring, till softened, about 2 minutes. Add the squash and cook, stirring, 3 minutes longer to soften. Add the remaining ingredients and stir well. Reduce the heat to a low simmer, cover, and cook for 1 hour, adding a little water if the stew begins to get too thick.
ingredients: 1 small green bell pepper, seeded and chopped
2 medium-size yellow squash or zucchini, scrubbed, ends trimmed, and chopped
1 tablespoon chopped fresh oregano leaves, or 1/2 teaspoon dried, crumbled
1 tablespoon chopped fresh basil leaves, or 1/2 teaspoon dried, crumbled
Salt and freshly ground black pepper to taste
4 large, ripe tomatoes, chopped and juices retained
title: California Vegetable and Chickpea Chili
